intro: Xerochrysum macranthum, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Xerochrysum macranthum is also known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
